Kent Beck wrote:

> Separate instances don't guarantee test isolation. If you use global or
> external resources, they can carry state between tests. However, the
> separate instances give you a better chance of writing isolated tests.

To add to Kent's comment, I find that keeping test instances separate 
from one another encourages me to think about how to design my objects 
to be easily instantiated. I find this has improved my designs dramatically.
